posts.post_content:
Fun, flavorful, and unique, but I'd have preferred it if he had 5 toughness to put him out of [burn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=193648) range. Of course since he's blue, it shouldn't be hard to protect him should he hit the field, but I'd have a hard time every playing this against any deck with red for fear of losing my 10 mana investment to a 1 CMC common. (For some reason, it just seems more insulting to get him burned for 4 than to have him hit with [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) or [Go For the Throat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Go For the Throat).)  
  
Then again, even if he had 5 toughness, he'd still be susceptible to [Artillerize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Artillerize), and the to-be-reprinted-in-M12 [Goblin Grenade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Grenade).
posts.html:
Fun, flavorful, and unique, but I'd have preferred it if he had 5 toughness to put him out of burn range. Of course since he's blue, it shouldn't be hard to protect him should he hit the field, but I'd have a hard time every playing this against any deck with red for fear of losing my 10 mana investment to a 1 CMC common. (For some reason, it just seems more insulting to get him burned for 4 than to have him hit with Doom Blade or Go For the Throat.)

Then again, even if he had 5 toughness, he'd still be susceptible to Artillerize, and the to-be-reprinted-in-M12 Goblin Grenade.

posts.post_content:
I just realized each of the Praetors seems to have a "signature spell", a la the M11 planeswalkers.  
  
Elesh Norn - [Norn's Annex](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Norn's Annex)  
Jin-Gitaxias - [Gitaxian Probe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gitaxian Probe)  
Sheoldred - [Reaper of Sheoldred](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reaper of Sheoldred)  
Urabrask - [Priest of Urabrask](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Priest of Urabrask)  
Vorinclex - this is the iffy one. Unlike the other four, nothing else in the block has his name in it ... but guess which green sorcery showed up in Mirrodin Beseiged that actually **shows** Vorinclex in its art?  
  
That's right. [Praetors' Counsel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Praetors' Counsel).
posts.html:
I just realized each of the Praetors seems to have a "signature spell", a la the M11 planeswalkers.

Elesh Norn - Norn's Annex
Jin-Gitaxias - Gitaxian Probe
Sheoldred - Reaper of Sheoldred
Urabrask - Priest of Urabrask
Vorinclex - this is the iffy one. Unlike the other four, nothing else in the block has his name in it ... but guess which green sorcery showed up in Mirrodin Beseiged that actually shows Vorinclex in its art?

That's right. Praetors' Counsel.

Posted By: MyrBattlecube (10/23/2011 6:55:46 PM)

posts.post_content:
Are you f\*cking kidding me?!  
  
I thought [Guile](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Guile) would never be dethroned as my favorite Blue creature,  
but it looks like I was wrong.  
  
With power like this, it's no wonder Phyrexia was able to conquer Mirrodin.  
  
He's not even a graveyard dodger, making him one of the best creatures you could possibly reanimate,  
and even if you hard cast him, he only costs 1 more than the 7-card [Braingeyser](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Braingeyser) he gives you (*every turn*),  
with the \*fairly\* useful bonus of destroying your opponent's entire hand.  
  
You've already won if you get Gitaxias out for a full turn,  
but it would be a fun time to start casting [Show and Tell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Show and Tell) and [Eureka](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eureka), nonetheless.  
  
Screw Braingeyser and Helm of Obedience;  
My [Mana Drain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Drain)s have a new mission.  
  
Another fun, if evil play:  
R1- [Leyline of Anticipation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leyline of Anticipation), [Swamp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swamp); [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual), [Entomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Entomb) and au... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Are you f*cking kidding me?!

I thought Guile would never be dethroned as my favorite Blue creature,
but it looks like I was wrong.

With power like this, it's no wonder Phyrexia was able to conquer Mirrodin.

He's not even a graveyard dodger, making him one of the best creatures you could possibly reanimate,
and even if you hard cast him, he only costs 1 more than the 7-card Braingeyser he gives you (every turn),
with the *fairly* useful bonus of destroying your opponent's entire hand.

You've already won if you get Gitaxias out for a full turn,
but it would be a fun time to start casting Show and Tell and Eureka, nonetheless.

Screw Braingeyser and Helm of Obedience;
My Mana Drains have a new mission.

Posted By: Totema (10/12/2011 8:38:50 PM)

posts.post_content:
Absolutely the best card I have seen yet.  
  
Threw him in my deck with my [Lighthouse Chronologist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lighthouse Chronologist), [Rite of Replication](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rite of Replication), [High Tide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=High Tide), [Reminisce](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reminisce), and [Time Stop](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Stop).  
  
Yes, that's right...  
  
To one of your turns I take seven, and each seven-turn cycle takes me through all my spells and puts it back for the next cycle. Meanwhile, you have nothing to use against me, and even if you did, your turn ends as soon as I tell it to. And, yes, I take *seven more*.  
  
This is why I play blue. 5/5
posts.html:
Absolutely the best card I have seen yet.

Threw him in my deck with my Lighthouse Chronologist, Rite of Replication, High Tide, Reminisce, and Time Stop.

Yes, that's right...

To one of your turns I take seven, and each seven-turn cycle takes me through all my spells and puts it back for the next cycle. Meanwhile, you have nothing to use against me, and even if you did, your turn ends as soon as I tell it to. And, yes, I take seven more.

This is why I play blue. 5/5
